channel.title: Jarring Tutorial
channel.description:
[i]Please note this is my first tutorial so feedback is wanted. :)[/i]
Well a lot of people seem to have trouble jarring for some odd reason. I see a lot of webclient tutorials on here but no real jar tutorial besides maybe a video to go with the webclient so here goes. Please post feedback and anything(if anything) I did wrong.
Loveandpower's Jaring Tutorial Difficulty: Easy Purpose: To turn your 317 client into a jarred client for your rsps. To also help make it harder for leechers to leech and to help protect your work. Client's Tested on: Galkons Refactored 317( No idea how it works on a 508 etc as I have never used.) Classes Modified: Signlink.java and cachedownloader.java
Credits: Ric - For his video on jarring which got me using it and knowing how to jar. Whoever made JarMaker The Respectful Cache/Client Owners
Special thanks to: Ric, he was an inspiration for this. :)
So let's get started!
[hr] [u][b] Step 1: Gathering what you need[/b][/u]
-For reference purposes for other files you may need use this link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,336494.0.html -This jarmaker program - http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/products/utilities/jarmaker/JARMaker.zip -A client -A cache
[u][b]Step 2: Naming your cache(optional)[/b][/u]
-Go to [b]signlink.java[/b]and look for [code]public static String findcachedir() { [/code] -Where the "" are is where you would add the name of the cache there. -Then you need to go to your actual cache folder, right click, and rename it to whatever you added into signlink.java. -Save and compile your client now.
[u][b]Step 3: Preparing the cache![/b][/u]
-First off, you need to open up your cache folder and you will see some .dat files and then a bunch of folders. -ZIP ALL the file in that folder, but not the cache folder itself. -Go to https://www.dropbox.com/home#::: , create an account there. -After you created the account you need to upload the cache you just zipped to dropbox. You will then need to move the cache to the [b]public[/b] folder. -After you have moved it to the public folder go to the cache and go to the right of that file click on the little arrow item and go down to copy download link. Copy and paste this link into your [b]cachedownloader.java[/b]. The area where you add it should be something like this
[code]private String cacheLink = "add the dropbox link here!"; // Link to cache[/code]
-Save the file and compile.
[u][b]Step 4: Jarring your client [/b][/u] -Open up JarMaker.jar -To make this easier I will break this up! --Output Directory(find the jarmaker folder on your computer) --Output JAR file:(Name of your .jar so you could put "Hi MoparScape.jar" and it would be listed as that after it is jarred.) --Input Directory(find the client folder of yours)
-Okay now you have that small part finished. You need to now go to the bottom where it says "Manifest Template" --Main Class:(type in "cllient")
-Then press Set Manifest -Press Create Jar
[b]Congratulations you have made the jar file! But hold on! We need to sign it now. :)[/b] [u][b] Step 5: Signing your jar[/b][/u]
-Jarsigner Location(What this is asking for is your jarsigner.exe in your java folder. You can access it by going to [b]My Computer->Local Disk C->Program Files->Java-> JDK->Bin->Jarsigner.exe[/b]
-Keystore File:(Just like with the jarsigner it is asking for another exe file from your java folder to do this there are a few extra steps.) --Click Generate KeyStore ---Keytool Location(This is where you select the .exe file. So go to [b]My Computer-.Local Disk C->Program Files->Java->JDK->Bin->Keytool.exe[/b] ---Output Keystore File:(What this is asking is for you to select your keystore file to be read.by the .exe file. So for this you would open up the browse selection and pretty much create any file name you wish. Most people put like "certificate" or "certficateforblah" ---Keystore Alias(Think of it like a username) ---Public Key(Think of it like a password to be created) ---Private Key(Think of it like the "confirm password" box) ---Keystore identities ( Have no real meaning you can delete the info inside of it.)
-You can now click Generate KeyStore! -Now that you have set up the keytool, you should use the browse feature for [b]Keystore File[/b]and select the filename you created for it just a few moments ago.
-Keystore Authentication --Keystore Alias(username you made earlier) --Public Key(password you entered earlier) --Private Key(the same password as public key)
-Click Sign Jar
[b]Congratulations you have successfully infiltrated the land of jarring and signing! I hope this guide has helped you.[/b]

item.title: Jarring Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @ggson ggson
item.description:
@ggson wrote:

I need some major help, my webclient wont work no matter which site I use.
When I use wix it comes up with error. click for details so i do then it comes up with clientnotfoundexception client.class then when i use the 000host.com as a website host it comes up with the same thing but ClassformatError Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client! PLEASE HELP?!?! here is my thread, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,613002.msg4238393.html#msg4238393
p.s. im giving rep+++!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:53, topic:393633”] jar cvfm manifest.txt <classfiles>

The only reason that one would need to sign the jar, is if the client needs special permissions (like referencing the “user.home” property).[/quote]considering the base I used for an example then it would be required to be referenced from a certain directory though 0.o but yeah I know what you mean <3

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

jar cvfm manifest.txt <classfiles>

The only reason that one would need to sign the jar, is if the client needs special permissions (like referencing the “user.home” property).
